Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Jug
Description: Large-sized jug with wide mouth, straight rim, short slightly truncate cone-shaped neck, curved walls and convex unstable base. The surface has a reddish coating and the upper third presents a painted decoration of three longitudinal lines parallel to a series of transversal triangles. On the neck greenish oxide marks are preserved, probably from a copper vase which served as its lid.
